conclusion: There are four objects above a flat surface.
A, B, C, and D are the shadows cast by these objects on the ground.
The light source is illuminating these objects from above.
The light source is at a certain position, casting shadows A, B, C, and D.
The size and position of each shadow depend on the angle and distance between the light source and the objects.
The light source moves backward, which means it moves away from the objects.

premise: The light source moves backward, which means it moves away from the objects.
conclusion: When the light source moves backward, the shadows will shift towards the light source. This means the shadows will move closer to their respective objects on the ground.
